p.s: The Sonnet number 116 which is written by William Shakespeare, deals with the changes in a relationship.
The poet reflects on his love and how time havehas changed their relationship.
Sonnet 116 is part of the sonnet sequence from 1 to 126, which also is addressed to a young woman.
The sonnet contains the typical Shakespearean sonnet strucuture.
In the first of the three quatrains, the author says that he does not want a marriage just out of society standards.
It is an obstacle between their love.
Furthermore he describes that love isn't meant to change because of alterations in their life (cf. l. 2f.).
In addition to that the author explains that love isn't love when someone decidedecides to take another or a new way (cf. l. 4).
In the second quatrain he points out that love should stay forever and it is a sign.
He relates his idea of love to ships in the ocean that come into a storm but usually it is never shaken (cf. l. 6).
Love is the landmark that shows everyone the right way or to help everyone to find the right direction (cf. l. 7).
The third quatrain deals with the distance between him and his love.
He thinks about if it's really worth it and says that the value is unknown (cf. l. 8).
The author puts love in relation to the time and describes that love isn't the timestime's fool.
The author comes to the decision that their love slowly comecomes to an end and that love should not be changed by hours and weeks.
ThereforTherefore it has to stay forever to the death (cf. l. 11f).
In the final couplet (l. 13f.) the author says that if all of that and his love is a mistake then he has never written and no man ever loved (cf. l. 14).
So, the author explained his idea of love and that changes should not also change the relationship.
When love comes thanthen it should stay forever to death.
